message_1: A vegetable seller has 1000 tomatoes and 500 cucumbers, and they have only space to store 800 vegetables. The price of a tomato is 2 dollars and a cucumber is 1 dollar. The seller wants to choose the combination of vegetables that will give them the highest revenue, subject to the constraint that they can only store up to 800 vegetables. What combination of tomatoes and cucumbers should the seller choose to maximize their total revenue?
message_2: To maximize the total revenue, the seller should prioritize storing the vegetables with the higher price, which are the tomatoes. Since they can store up to 800 vegetables, they should store 800 tomatoes, which will give them a total revenue of 800 * 2 = 1600 dollars. They won't be able to store any cucumbers in this case, but this combination will give them the highest possible revenue given the constraint.
